intro: Pycreus lanceus var. melanopus, commonly known as the black-leafed pycreus, is a rare and striking plant characterized by its dark, almost black foliage. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to specific regions in southern Africa. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves that are densely arranged along its stem. Its flowers are small and white, forming umbels that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists.
